docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Important Links:

| Website | Support Server | Patreon |

Understanding how to use commands

Do not literally type out < > [ ] | ...

These are just to display information about the arguments.

Some examples of these in use would be:

!rps|rockpaperscissors <choice>

then both of these will execute the command.

!rps <choice>

and

!rockpaperscissors <choice>

To use the Rock, Paper, Scissors command you would type this:

!rps rock

Understanding command arguments

If you see a command with an argument ending with ... this means that this one argument will accept multiple of the same type of argument one after another. Let's use this kick command for example.

!kick <members>... <reason>

If you want to kick more than one user for the same reason then you would type it like this.

!kick @someone @someoneelse They were annoying me

For this command, you could also use the users' IDs if you don't wish to mention the users. If you are not sure how to get a users ID please check out this article on Where can I find my User/Server/Message ID. For example:

!kick 123456789 987654321

An argument wrapped with [ or ] just means that the argument is optional. For example with the

docs.title: Global required permissions
docs.text:
Friday requires some permissions for all commands. These include:

  • send_messages
  • read_messages
  • embed_links
  • add_reactions

docs.title: Prefix
docs.text: The default prefix for Friday's commands is !, and for commands to execute every command needs this prefix or the custom prefix that you can set with the prefix command.

docs.title: Slash commands
docs.text: Friday also supports slash commands. To use these commands, go to any text channel and start typing /, you should be greeted with a list of commands from bots and built-in commands.

docs.title: Why is Friday not responding to me
docs.text: Friday will respond to @mentions, if you reply to a message from Friday or the channel is set to be a chat channel with !chatchannel. If Friday still doesn't respond then please let me know in the #issues channel in the support server

docs.title: Why is Friday repeating herself?
docs.text: Because Friday "thinks"/generates her own responses I am not currently sure why this is happening (lol). The current workaround is to use the !reset command, which resets her chat history

docs.title: How to use the bot?
docs.text: For commands, they are all listed if you use the command !help or on https://docs.friday-bot.com. For chat just mention friday and she will respond to your message

docs.title: How do I make a channel where I don't need to mention the bot to chat?
docs.text: The chatchannel command is what you're looking for. !chatchannel #channel and more information on https://docs.friday-bot.com/commands/chat/#chatchannel.

docs.title: Chatting with Friday
docs.text:
Friday is a chatbot so these are the ways to make sure that if Friday has a response that you get that response

  • Mentioning Friday (or using a reply) eg.
@Friday hey, how are you?
  • Setting a channel to be the chat channel. Friday will respond to every message in that channel as if they were directed to Friday. Eg:
hey, what is it like being a bot?

docs.title: Max message length
docs.text: By default, Friday has a maximum message length that she will respond to. For free users, this is set to 100 characters. To get longer message length become a patreon

docs.title: Rate limiting
docs.text:
Friday has a rate limit per user to help reduce spam and keep costs low. The absolute maximum rate limits are not under my control on what they are. Currently, the rate limits are:

  • 30 messages every 12 hours per user for user that have not voted for Friday and not at least a tier 1 Patreon.
  • 60 messages every 12 hours per user for users that have voted.
  • 100 messages every 12 hours per user for members or guilds that are at least a tier 1 Patreon.
  • 6 messages every 20 seconds per user absolute maximum.
  • 180 messages every 1 hour per user absolute maximum.

docs.title: Using a chat channel
docs.text: If your server has a set chat channel using the !chatchannel #channel command. You do not need to mention Friday in that channel to talk to her. She will respond to messages without being mentioned.

docs.title: Languages
docs.text:
By default, Friday can understand and speak a lot of languages, whether Friday actually will do this is not up to me unless you use the !language [langauge] command.

If you have changes Friday's language to something other than English with the language command, Friday will speak two languages in the server that you used the command in. One of the languages will be the one that you chose and the other will be English.

docs.title: Personas
docs.text: Personas are only available to patrons. Friday currently has two personas to choose from: Pirate, where Friday will talk like a pirate, and default where Friday is focused on having a good time chatting to everyone. More personas are planned and in-progress.

docs.title: Automod
docs.text: There are somethings in this world that bots are better at then humans. Let Friday help out with the moderation of your Discord server.

docs.title: Contentspam
docs.text:
Sets the max number of message that can have the same content (ignoring who sent the message) until passing the given threshold and muting anyone spamming the same content further.

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

UsageExamples 
!contentspam <message_rate> <seconds>
!contentspam disable 
!contentspam punishment <punishments>

!contentspam 3 5
!contentspam 15 17

docs.title: Disable
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Disable the max amount of messages per x seconds with the same content for this server.

Usage 
!contentspam disable

docs.title: Punishment
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Set the punishment for the max amount of message every x seconds. Combining kick,ban and/or mute will only apply one of them.

UsageAliasesExamples 
!contentspam punishment|punishments <punishments>

punishments

!contentspam punishment delete
!contentspam punishments kick
!contentspam punishment ban
!contentspam punishments mute

docs.title: Invitespam
docs.text:
Automaticaly remove Discord invites (originating from external servers) from text channels. Not giving an argument will display the current setting.

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

UsageAliasesExamples 
!invitespam|removeinvites [enable]

removeinvites

!invitespam
!removeinvites 1
!invitespam 0
!removeinvites true
!invitespam false

docs.title: Mentionspam
docs.text:

maxmentions,maxpings

!mentionspam 3
!maxmentions 5
!maxpings 10

!ban 40d 123456789 2 Sus

docs.title: Server
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Activate the server that you would like to apply your patronage to

Usage 
!patreon server 
!patreon server activate 
!patreon server deactivate

Pong!

docs.title: Redditlink
docs.text:
Extract the media from Reddit posts with Friday's Reddit command and more.

Friday has a feature that will extract Reddit media. To use this feature simply paste the link to a Reddit post in a text channel and Friday will react with 🔗 if media is extractable. To extract the media just react with 🔗 as well, and Friday will begin the process.

docs.title: Redditextract
docs.text:
Extracts the media from the reddit post

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Usage 
!redditextract <link>
!redditextract enable <enable>

docs.title: Enable
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Enable or disabled Friday's reddit link extraction. (When disabled Friday won't react to reddit links.)

Usage 
!redditextract enable <enable>

docs.title: Reminder
docs.text: Set reminders for yourself

docs.title: Reminder
docs.text:
Create a reminder for a certain time in the future.

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

UsageAliasesExamples 
!reminder|timer|remind <when> <message>
!reminder|timer|remind clear 
!reminder|timer|remind delete <id>
!reminder|timer|remind list 

timer,remind

!reminder 20m go buy food
!timer do something in 20m
!remind jan 1st happy new years

docs.title: Clear
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Delete all your reminders.

Usage 
!reminder clear

docs.title: Delete
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Delete a reminder.

UsageAliasesExamples 
!reminder delete|remove|cancel <id>

remove,cancel

!reminder delete 1
!timer remove 200

docs.title: List
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

List all reminders.

Usage 
!reminder list

docs.title: Set
docs.text:

docs.title: Stars
docs.text:
A starboard to upvote posts obviously.

There are two ways to make use of this feature, the first is via reactions, react to a message with ⭐ and the bot will automatically add (or remove) it to the starboard.

The second way is via Developer Mode. Enable it under Settings > Appearance > Developer Mode and then you get access to Copy ID and using the star/unstar commands.

docs.title: Star
docs.text:
Stars a message via message ID.

To star a message you should right click on the on a message and then click "Copy ID". You must have Developer Mode enabled to get that functionality.

It is recommended that you react to a message with ⭐ instead.

You can only star a message once.

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

UsageExamples 
!star <message>
!star clean <stars>
!star limit <stars>
!star lock 
!star migrate 
!star random 
!star show <message>
!star stats [member]
!star unlock 

!star 707520808448294983
!star https://discord.com/channels/707441352367013899/707458929696702525/707520808448294983

docs.title: Clean
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Cleans the starboard

This removes messages in the starboard that only have less than or equal to the number of specified stars. This defaults to 1.

Note that this only checks the last 100 messages in the starboard.

This command requires the Manage Server permission.

UsageExamples 
!star clean <stars>

!star clean 1
!star clean 3

docs.title: Limit
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Sets the minimum number of stars required to show up.

When this limit is set, messages must have this number or more to show up in the starboard channel.

You cannot have a negative number and the maximum star limit you can set is 100.

Note that messages that previously did not meet the limit but now do will still not show up in the starboard until starred again.

You must have Manage Server permissions to use this.

UsageAliasesExamples 
!star limit|threshold <stars>

threshold

!star limit 3
!star threshold 5

docs.title: Lock
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Locks the starboard from being processed.

This is a moderation tool that allows you to temporarily disable the starboard to aid in dealing with star spam.

When the starboard is locked, no new entries are added to the starboard as the bot will no longer listen to reactions or star/unstar commands.

To unlock the starboard, use the unlock subcommand.

To use this command you need Manage Server permission.

Usage 
!star lock

docs.title: Migrate
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Migrates the starboard to the newest version.

While doing this, the starboard is locked.

Note: This is an incredibly expensive operation.

It will take a very long time.

You must have Manage Server permissions to use this.

Usage 
!star migrate

docs.title: Random
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Shows a random starred message.

Usage 
!star random

docs.title: Show
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Shows a starred message via its ID.

To get the ID of a message you should right click on the message and then click "Copy ID". You must have Developer Mode enabled to get that functionality.

You can only use this command once per 10 seconds.

UsageExamples 
!star show <message>

!star show 707520808448294983
!star show https://discord.com/channels/707441352367013899/707458929696702525/707520808448294983

docs.title: Stats
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Shows statistics on the starboard usage of the server or a member.

UsageExamples 
!star stats [member]

!star stats
!star stats 215227961048170496
!star stats @Motostar

docs.title: Unlock
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Unlocks the starboard for re-processing.

To use this command you need Manage Server permission.

Usage 
!star unlock

docs.title: Starboard
docs.text:
Sets up the starboard for this server.

This creates a new channel with the specified name and makes it into the server's "starboard". If no name is passed in then it defaults to "starboard".

Choose wisely, this channel cannot be changed.

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

UsageExamples 
!starboard [name='starboard']
!starboard info 

!starboard
!starboard starboard

docs.title: Info
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Shows meta information about the starboard.

Usage 
!starboard info

docs.title: Unstar
docs.text:
Unstars a message via message ID.

To unstar a message you should right click on the on a message and then click "Copy ID". You must have Developer Mode enabled to get that functionality.

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

UsageExamples 
!unstar <message>

!unstar 707520808448294983
!unstar https://discord.com/channels/707441352367013899/707458929696702525/707520808448294983

docs.title: Topgg
docs.text:
Voting for Friday on Top.gg really helps with getting Friday to more people because the more votes a bot has the higher ranking it gets.

To get Friday higher in the rankings you can vote here top.gg/bot/476303446547365891/vote

When voting you will receive some cool perks currently including:

  • Better rate limits when chatting with Friday

docs.title: Vote
docs.text:
Get the link to vote for me on Top.gg

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Usage 
!vote

docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Friday's settings for welcoming new members to your servers

Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Usage 
!welcome 
!welcome ai <enabled>
!welcome channel <channel>
!welcome display 
!welcome message <message>
!welcome role <role>

docs.title: Ai
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Allows Friday to respond with a unique AI generated messages for every new member to the server

Usage 
!welcome ai <enabled>

docs.title: Channel
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Setup a welcome channel for Friday to welcome new memebers in

UsageExamples 
!welcome channel [channel]

!welcome channel
!welcome channel #welcome
!welcome channel #general
!welcome channel 707458929696702525

docs.title: Display
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Shows the servers current welcome settings

UsageAliases 
!welcome display|list|show 

list,show

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Set a message to greet new members to your server, message variables are {user},{server}

UsageExamples 
!welcome message [message]

!welcome message
!welcome message Welcome to the server {user}, stay a while!
!welcome message Welcome {user} to {server}
!welcome message A new member has joined the server!

docs.title: Role
docs.text:
Does not have a slash command to match

Learn more about slash commands

Set the role that is given to new members when they join the server

UsageExamples 
!welcome role [role]

!welcome role
!welcome role @default
!welcome role 12345678910

docs.title: Activate a server
docs.text:
So you have become a Patreon supporter and would like to receive your benefits. To activate Friday on your server of choosing simply go to that server and use the !patreon server true command. If you were to choose to deactivate please use the !patreon server false command.

To make sure that this command works in the server that you choose, double check the following.

  • You are in the "Friday Development" Discord server
  • You have the Supporting on Patreon role
  • You have the Proper role for your Patreon Tier. The roles will be named something like.
    • One server Patreons
    • Three server Patreons
    • Tier 2 One server Patreons
    • Tier 2 Three server Patreons

If you have checked all of the above and Friday is still not activating, please let me know in the #issues channel of the support server.

docs.title: Activate for yourself
docs.text:
Note

There is nothing extra you need to do for Fridays user perks to work. Any chat that you can communicate with Friday will have your perks.

docs.title: Voting
docs.text: Voting for Friday on Top.gg really helps with getting Friday to more people because the more votes a bot has the higher ranking it gets. To get Friday higher in the rankings you can vote here top.gg/bot/476303446547365891/vote

docs.title: What do I get for voting
docs.text:
When voting you will receive some cool perks currently including:

  • Better rate limits when chatting with Friday as displayed here
